meanings.definition: A gathering or social event where people engage in casual conversation or gossip.
meanings.sent1: The neighborhood gabfests at the park are always full of laughter and stories.
meanings.sent2: We had a lovely gabfest over coffee, sharing news and catching up.
meanings.sent3: The gabfest about the missing cat turned into a hilarious debate about who the real culprit was.
meanings.sent4: The gabfest in the office was like a symphony of voices, each adding a new note to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: Her gabfest about her vacation was so vivid, I felt like I had been there with her.

meanings.definition: A lively discussion or exchange of ideas.
meanings.sent1: The political gabfests on TV can get quite intense with all the different opinions.
meanings.sent2: During the book club meeting, there was a spirited gabfest about the ending of the novel.
meanings.sent3: The gabfest in the classroom turned into a friendly competition of who could come up with the best argument.
meanings.sent4: The gabfest at the conference was like a brainstorming session, ideas bouncing off the walls.
meanings.sent5: His gabfest about the future of technology was so engaging, I couldn't stop listening.
